children.value: two types of items in a graph. In the last chapter, we rendered the
with items with rough styles. Now, we are going to beautify the items while introducing the properties of the items.
two types of items in a graph. Several
are provided by G6. The main difference between different types of items is their
. For example, a node's graphics type can be a circle, a rect, an image, or others.
The properties of an item can be be divided into two categories:

The data structure of a node:
// The type of graphics shape of the node
// The relative position of the label
// The style properties of the label
// The font size of the label
// ...            // Other style properties of the label

The data structure of an edge is similar to node, but two more properties
of the source node and the
We can refine the visual requirements in figure 1 of
R1: Set the color for stroke and filling for nodes with

To satisfy different scenario, G6 provides 7 ways to configure the properties for items. Here we will only introduce two of them:
Configure the global properties when instantiating a Graph;
Configure the properties for different items in their data.

properties.ariaLabel: 1 configure the global properties when instantiating a graph permalink

children.value: 1. Configure the Global Properties When Instantiating a Graph
Unify the configurations for all the nodes or edges.
Configure it with two configurations of graph:
It is a way of unified global configuration, which does not distinguish the nodes with different properties (e.g.
) in their data. That is to say, only R1, R2, R3, and R4 can be satisfied now:
with items configured by global configurations.
for graph to achieve the expected effect:
// The style properties and other properties for all the nodes in the default state
// The line width of the stroke of nodes
// The properties for label of nodes
// The style properties for the label
// The style properties and other properties for all the edges in the default state
// The properties for label of edges
// Whether to rotate the label according to the edges

properties.ariaLabel: 2 configure the properties in data permalink

children.value: By this way, you can configure different items according to their properties in data.
Thus, the R5 and R6 can be satisfied now.
Write the properties into each item data, or traverse the data to assign the properties. Here we show assigning the attrbiutes into data by traversing:
// Configure the graphics type of nodes according to their class
// The graphics type is circle when class = 'c0'
// The graphics type is rect when class = 'c1'
// The graphics type is ellipse when class = 'c2'
From figure 3, we find some nodes are rendered as rects, some are ellipses. We also set the
is an array when the node is a rect or an ellipse. We did not set the
in global configuration will still take effect for circle node. That is to say, configuring items by writing into data has higher priority than global configurations.
We further set the line widths for edges according to their weight:
// Mapping the weight in data to lineWidth
The line width of the edges takes effect in the figure above. But the opacity and color setted in the global configurations are lost. The reason is that the global
object in graph instance is overrided by the second configure method. The solution is move all the styles to the data:
// The properties for label of edges
// Whether to rotate the label according to the edges
// Mapping the weight in data to lineWidth
// The styles are moved to here
to change the data into yours.
